p: The surgery team (surgeon, assistant, scrub nurse or circulating nurse) seem to be less exposed than the anaesthesia team (anaesthetist and anaesthetist's nurse), who are in direct contact with the patient's upper airways, which are the main source of contamination [19]. PPE is only one component of the protection measures. It must be used by every member of the HCP team according to the World Health Organisation (WHO) guidelines [20]. PPE includes long-sleeved fluid protection gowns, lined gloves, goggles (or visors, especially for the anaesthesia teams) [19], and masks.
